dmca.title: Blog Host Forwards Notice to Individual Blogger
dmca.body:
Date: Thu, 13 Nov 2003 13:53:09 -0800 
From: "Blogger Support" <PRIVATE> | Add to Address Book 
To: [PRIVATE]
Subject: [#19633] Blog*Spot Copyright issue 
       
 


Hi there -

My name's [PRIVATE]and I work here at Blogger. We've received a complaint that content in your blog:

http://infoaboutdkellymarsalis.blogspot.com

infringes upon the copyrights of others. The content in question are the posts dated:

http://infoaboutdkellymarsalis.blogspot.com/archives/ 2003_11_10_infoaboutdkellymarsalis_archive.html#106851960241958218
http://infoaboutdkellymarsalis.blogspot.com/archives/ 2003_11_10_infoaboutdkellymarsalis_archive.html#106851934236279280
http://infoaboutdkellymarsalis.blogspot.com/archives/ 2003_11_09_infoaboutdkellymarsalis_archive.html#106844029478584047
http://infoaboutdkellymarsalis.blogspot.com/archives/ 2003_11_09_infoaboutdkellymarsalis_archive.html#106839940128121867
http://infoaboutdkellymarsalis.blogspot.com/archives/ 2003_11_08_infoaboutdkellymarsalis_archive.html#106833198262475523

The notice that we received, with any personally identifying information removed, will be posted online by a service called Chilling Effects and we will send you the link of this notice.  We do this in accordance with the Digital Millenium Copyright Act (DMCA).

The DMCA is a United States copyright law that provides guidelines for online service provider liability in case of copyright infringement.  Please see http://www.educause.edu/issues/dmca.html for more information about the DMCA, and see http://www.google.com/dmca.html for the process that Blogger requires in order to make a DMCA complaint.

We are asking that you please remove the allegedly infringing content in your blog. If you do not do this in the next 10 days we will be forced to remove the posts in question. If we did not do so, we would be subject to a claim of copyright infringement, regardless of its merits. 

We can reinstate this content into your blog upon receipt of a counter notification pursuant to sections 512(g)(2) and 3) of the DMCA. For more information about the requirements of a counter notification, and a link to a sample counter notification, see http://google.com/dmca.html.

If you have legal questions about this notification, you should retain your own legal counsel. If you have any other questions about this notification, please let us know.

Thanks very much for your understanding.
